key_events.description: Physical vacancy decreased from 4.6% in November 2025 to 3.5% in December 2025.
Distributed R$ 0.82 per share in January 2026, with expectations to maintain this level in the first semester of 2026.
Portfolio revaluation in December 2025 resulted in a 0.20% increase.
Concluded 8th issuance of shares, raising approximately R$ 937 million to acquire 7 logistics assets.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Decreasing vacancy rates, consistent dividend distribution, positive portfolio revaluation, and strategic asset acquisitions through the 8th issuance support a bullish outlook.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Dependence on key tenants and broader economic downturns could negatively impact performance.

summary_markdown: XPLG11 shows positive signs with a decrease in physical vacancy from 4.6% in November 2025 to 3.5% in December 2025. The fund distributed R$ 0.82 per share in January 2026 and expects to maintain this in the first semester of 2026. A portfolio revaluation in December 2025 resulted in a 0.20% increase. The 8th issuance concluded, raising approximately R$ 937 million to acquire 7 logistics assets. Annualized dividend yield is 9.3% based on December 2025 closing price of R$ 105.82.
